titles.title: To prohibit a State from imposing a discriminatory commuter tax on nonresidents.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by the Yeas and Nays: 17 - 7.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Judiciary. H. Rept. 106-203.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 117.

action.text: Mr. Gekas moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2014.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 6/8/1999--Introduced. Prohibits a State from imposing a tax on the income earned in the State by nonresidents unless the tax is of substantial equality of treatment for the citizens of the State and the nonresidents so commuting.
